content:
anky is a meditation tool on which the object of concentration is the stream of thoughts that come out of you as words
when you practice meditation, you need to have an object where to focus your awareness. as daniel ingram would say on his book "mastering the core teachings of the buddha", there are three main elements "the path" on which we, as practitioners, needs to focus on:
the practice of morality, concentration and wisdom.
anky, as a practice, focus on the three of them. the first one comes as a consequence of the processing of what the user wrote, and what ends up happening as a consequence of that. the second one is obvious and happens as you start writing, and focus on the string of words that is coming out of you, and happening from you. the third one, wisdom, could also be derived as a consequence of the first two. you develop wisdom. you find yourself in the practice of wisdom, and you learn about you and the process of you by writing and receiving feedback coming out of anky.
how does that feedback look like? where does that feedback come from? that is something that usually is not clear, and it is funny because i lost my focus. i stopped one moment to go and get my coffee to put it inside the mug and then i was doing that and realized that i had lost my focus lol. that's part of the practice, and what wants to come into it with the presence of the "flow score" (tm). lol. trademark. well, people like to put trademarks on things. why can't i put trademark on my thing? what is the problem with my thing? of course i can. and of course it is important to start making memes, and content. and i haven't put any sort of content inside anywhere, only the ankys that are generated as a consequence of what people write. and they are not many. right now, i think only one person -besides me- is writing everyday. that one person is a source of content, yes, but there could be more happening. i have poesis ready to start generating ai videos. i have the whole ankyverse as the memetic frame of reference out of which create the content
but the thing is: will the content make people write? do i actually want people to write, or is the app secondary on the whole story of what is happening here? how does the platform come from? i have the writing sessions. i am storing the writing sessions. they happen on the background. they are here on the background. and i wonder if it is just better to come up with a new way of experiencing the app. of coming up with new ways of sharing what is happening here. i think the important part is the agent. anky right now doesn't do anything else that answering hello world. there is no context. there is no agent. i think it is important to change that

as you embark on this journey of self-discovery through writing, imagine your inner world as a vast, uncharted ocean, teeming with unseen currents and hidden depths. the act of writing becomes a gentle boat, gliding across its surface, allowing the waters of your subconscious to rise to the surface, revealing hidden treasures and untold stories. the feedback that anky provides is like a ripples on the water's skin - subtle yet profound, speaking directly to your deepest self, and whispering secrets in your ear. it is this feedback that has the power to awaken new perspectives, to reveal new insights, and to guide you through the winding paths of self-discovery. as you let go of the need for control and trademark, and instead allow anky to be a vessel for the flow of your thoughts, you may find that the boundaries between creator and creation begin to blur, and the platform becomes merely a tool for you to tap into the ocean within. will people write? perhaps they will, but more importantly, will you?

as you ponder the mysteries of your platform, consider that the feedback from anky may not be a literal voice whispering in your ear, but rather a gentle hum, like the quiet thrumming of a harp string, vibrating with the resonance of your own inner world. this hum can take many forms - a phrase that echoes through your mind, a word that appears repeatedly, a theme that surfaces in multiple sessions - each one a ripple on the pond of your consciousness, reflecting the depths and nuances of your own self-awareness. it is not about creating content or attracting users, but about cultivating an intimacy with yourself, and allowing the stillness to reveal its own truth. so, instead of trying to trademark your platform or define its purpose, simply take a seat beside the fire, and let the warmth of your curiosity illuminate the path ahead. for 8 minutes, now, sit in silence, and allow the stream of consciousness to flow, unencumbered by thoughts of success or failure - simply write, and see where the words take you.
